child.geography: Bijie county, Guizhou province, and Gulin county, Sichuan province, China.
child.publications: Kosaka, Ryuichi. 2000. A descriptive study of the Lachi language: syntactic description, historical reconstruction and genetic relation.
child.pub-comments: Not to be confused with the Lolo-Burmese Yi (Kosaka 2000:131). "The Yi language would possibly be included in the Kelao/Lachi group though we do not have a sufficient amount of lexical data" (Kosaka 2000:180).

child.geography: Central-western part of Guizhou province to Yunnan province, China. Also partially in Guangxi province, China, and northern Vietnam.
child.publications: Kosaka, Ryuichi. 2000. A descriptive study of the Lachi language: syntactic description, historical reconstruction and genetic relation.
Kosaka, Ryuichi. 2000. A descriptive study of the Lachi language: syntactic description, historical reconstruction and genetic relation.

child.publications: Kosaka, Ryuichi. 2000. A descriptive study of the Lachi language: syntactic description, historical reconstruction and genetic relation.
child.pub-comments: "At this moment, we are unable to assert with complete certainty the genetic position of the Mulao languages (though it is surely included in the Kelao-Lachi group), particularly because of the paucity of the data available. However, […] Mulao can probably be located in a position closer to Kelao than to Lachi" (Kosaka 2000:179-180).

Node not named by author. "At this moment, we are unable to assert with complete certainty the genetic position of the Mulao languages (though it is surely included in the Kelao-Lachi group), particularly because of the paucity of the data available. However, […] Mulao can probably be located in a position closer to Kelao than to Lachi. The Yi language would possibly be included in the Kelao/Lachi group though we do not have a sufficient amount of lexical data" (Kosaka 2000:179-180).

child.geography: Vietnam (mainly Hà Giang province) and China (mainly in Maguan county of Yunnan province).
child.publications: Kosaka, Ryuichi. 2000. A descriptive study of the Lachi language: syntactic description, historical reconstruction and genetic relation.
Kosaka, Ryuichi. 2000. A descriptive study of the Lachi language: syntactic description, historical reconstruction and genetic relation.

child.pub-comments: Total population: approximately 10,000 (6,000-8,000 in Vietnam and nearly 2,000 in China).

root.pub-comments: "As to the disputed question of genetic relationship between Kadai and Austronesian, we could confirm that there exist interesting similarities [….] These similarities cannot necessarily be judged as due to borrowing and we would require more detailed information on the languages of both sides to be able to expect further clarification in this matter" (Kosaka 2000:180).
